Previous Next

Dudhsagar Falls

Dudhsagar Waterfall is a majestic waterfall located in the Western Ghats of India, on the border of Goa and Karnataka. Here's essential information for tourists:

Location
  • Located in Bhagwan Mahaveer Sanctuary and Mollem National Park
  • Border of Goa and Karnataka, India

Waterfall Details
  • Height: 310 meters (1,017 feet)
  • Width: 30 meters (100 feet)
  • Water flow: Highest during monsoon season (July-September)

How to Reach
  • By Train: Nearest railway station is Castle Rock (Karnataka) or Kulem (Goa)
  • By Road: 60 km from Panaji (Goa), 80 km from Belgaum (Karnataka)
  • By Trek: 10 km trek from Kulem or Castle Rock

Trekking Options
  • Easy trek from Kulem (10 km, 3-4 hours)
  • Challenging trek from Castle Rock (14 km, 5-6 hours)

Best Time to Visit
  • Monsoon season (July-September) for maximum water flow
  • Winter (November-February) for clear skies and comfortable weather

Activities
  • Trekking
  • Hiking
  • Swimming (at own risk)
  • Photography
  • Wildlife spotting

Safety Precautions
  • Be cautious of strong water currents
  • Avoid swimming during peak monsoon
  • Wear comfortable shoes and clothing
  • Carry water, snacks, and first-aid kit

Accommodation
  • Government guesthouses in Mollem
  • Private resorts and hotels in Goa
  • Camping options near the waterfall

Entry Fees
  • ₹50 (Indians)
  • ₹200 (foreigners)

Tips
  • Plan ahead and book accommodations in advance
  • Hire local guides for trekking
  • Respect the environment and wildlife
  • Carry necessary permits and documents

Page no: 3/4

Detailed View :

Previous Next

Barki Falls

Barki Waterfall is a scenic waterfall located in Khed, Pune District, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:

Overview
  • Height: 100 feet (30 meters)
  • Type: Seasonal waterfall
  • Best Time to Visit: July to October (monsoon season)

Location
  • District: Pune
  • State: Maharashtra
  • Nearest City: Pune (65 km)
  • Nearest Town: Khed (20 km)

Places to Explore
  • Barki Waterfall: Main waterfall with stunning views
  • Khed Shivapur Temple: Ancient temple (15 km)
  • Rajgad Fort: Historic fort (30 km)
  • Torna Fort: Historic fort (40 km)
  • Pune City: Explore historic landmarks, museums, and cultural events (65 km)

Things to Do
  • Trekking: Explore scenic trails surrounding the waterfall
  • Photography: Capture stunning views and moments
  • Swimming: Enjoy swimming in designated areas
  • Picnic: Relax and enjoy a picnic with family and friends
  • Birdwatching: Spot rare bird species in the surrounding forests

Tips and Essentials
  • Wear comfortable footwear and clothing
  • Carry sunscreen, hats, and water
  • Respect local culture and environment
  • Follow safety guidelines and instructions
  • Food and Water: Carry sufficient supplies

Safety Precautions
  • Weather: Avoid visiting during heavy rainfall or flooding
  • Terrain: Slippery rocks and uneven terrain, wear proper footwear
  • Wildlife: Be aware of snakes and other wildlife

How to Reach
  • By Air: Nearest airport is Pune (65 km)
  • By Train: Nearest railway station is Khed (20 km)
  • By Road: State transport buses and private vehicles available from Mumbai, Pune, and nearby cities

Timings
  • Summer: 9 am to 6 pm
  • Winter: 9 am to 5 pm

Entry Fees
  • Indians: ₹20
  • Foreigners: ₹100

Accommodation
  • Budget-friendly guesthouses
  • Luxury resorts
  • Camping options available

Additional Tips:
  • Carry a first-aid kit
  • Respect local customs and traditions
  • Follow local guidelines for photography
  • Enjoy the scenic views and serenity of the waterfall!

Best Time to Visit Barki Waterfall:
  • Monsoon season (July to October) for maximum water flow
  • Post-monsoon season (November to December) for lush green surroundings
  • Winter season (January to February) for pleasant weather

Nearby Attractions:
  • Khed Shivapur Temple
  • Rajgad Fort
  • Torna Fort
  • Pune City
  • Sinhagad Fort (50 km)

Page no: 3/4

Detailed View :

Previous Next

Dugarwadi Falls

Dugarwadi Falls is a scenic waterfall located in Nashik district, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:

Location
  • Located in Nashik district, Maharashtra, India
  • 30 km from Nashik city
  • Near Trimbakeshwar

Waterfall Details
  • Height: 30 meters (100 feet)
  • Water flow: Best during monsoon season (July-September)

How to Reach
  • By Road: 30 km from Nashik city via NH848
  • By Public Transport: Bus from Nashik to Trimbakeshwar, then local transport

Trekking Options
Easy trek from Trimbakeshwar (2 km, 30-45 minutes)
Best Time to Visit
  • Monsoon season (July-September) for maximum water flow
  • Winter (November-February) for clear skies and comfortable weather

Activities
  • Trekking
  • Hiking
  • Swimming (at own risk)
  • Photography
  • Picnicking

Safety Precautions
  • Be cautious of strong water currents
  • Avoid swimming during peak monsoon
  • Wear comfortable shoes and clothing
  • Carry water, snacks, and first-aid kit

Accommodation
  • Hotels and resorts in Nashik city
  • Budget-friendly options in Trimbakeshwar

Tips
  • Plan ahead and check weather forecast
  • Wear suitable footwear
  • Respect local environment and culture
  • Carry necessary permits and documents

Page no: 2/4

Maharastra National Parks:

Gorewada national park

Balasaheb Thackeray Gorewada International Zoological Park, known earlier as the Gorewada Zoo,is a zoo in the Nagpur district of the Indian state of Maharashtra. Upon completion, this is likely to be one of the largest captive zoo safaris in India, covering over 1914 hectares of land adjoining Gorewada Lake.

Tadoba National Park

The Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve is a wildlife sanctuary in Chandrapur district of Maharashtra state in India. It is Maharashtra's oldest and largest national park. Created in 1955, the reserve includes the Tadoba National Park and the Andhari Wildlife Sanctuary. The reserve consists of 577.96 square kilometres (223.15 sq mi) of reserved forest and 32.51 square kilometres (12.55 sq mi) of protected forest.

Melghat National Park

Melghat tiger reserve is located in the Amaravati district of Maharashtra. Melghat Tiger Reserve is located on the southern offshoot of the Satpura Hill Range in Central India, called Gavilgarh Hill. It is 225 km west of Nagpur. It was established as a wildlife sanctuary in 1967, and was declared a tiger reserve in 1974. It was among the first nine tiger reserves notified in 1973-74 under Project Tiger, a wildlife conservation project initiated in India in 1972 to protect Bengal tigers. It was the first tiger reserve of Maharashtra.

Sanjay Gandhi National Park

Sanjay Gandhi National Park is an 87 km2 (34 sq mi) protected area in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It was established in 1969 with its headquarters situated at Borivali. The 2400-year-old Kanheri caves, sculpted by monks out of the rocky basaltic cliffs, lie within the park. The rich flora and fauna of the Sanjay Gandhi National Park attract more than 2 million visitors every year

Nawegaon National Park

Navegaon National Park is a National park located in the Arjuni Morgaon subdivision of Gondia district in state of Maharashtra, India. The Dr Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary, Navegaon is home to almost 60% of the bird species found in entire Maharashtra. Every winter, flocks of migratory birds visit the lake. The national park has diverse type of vegetation ranging from dry mixed forest to moist forest. The forest type is 5 A/C3. Southern tropical dry deciduous forest

Amte Animal Ark

Amte's Animal Ark houses about 115 orphaned animals. Madia-Gond tribes weren't an agrarian community and would hunt for animals. It was to conserve animals that Lok Biradari Prakalp opened a rescue centre. The tribe still hunts for animals during the festivals and give young orphaned animals to the Ark. In exchange, they get rice, vegetables or clothing. The Ark also conducts "Save the snakes" campaign. Dr. Prakash Amte believes that everyone should be sensitive and loving towards all animals.

Rajiv Gandhi Zoological park

The Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park, commonly known as the Rajiv Gandhi Zoo or Katraj Zoo, is located in Katraj, Pune district, Maharashtra State, India. It is managed by the Pune Municipal Corporation. The 130-acre (53 ha) zoo is divided into three parts: an animal orphanage, a snake park and a zoo and includes the 42-acre (17 ha) Katraj Lake.

Veermata Jijabai Bhosale Botanical Udyan and Zoo

Jijamata Udyaan, also known as the Byculla Zoo and formerly Victoria Gardens, is a zoo and garden covering 50 acres located at Byculla, in the heart of Mumbai, India. It is the oldest public garden in Mumbai.After Indian independence, it was named after Jijamata, the mother of Shivaji, the first Maratha emperor.

Chandoli National Park

Chandoli National Park is a national park established in Sangli district in May 2004.Earlier it was a Wildlife Sanctuary declared in 1985. Chandoli Park is notable as the southern portion of the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve, with Koyna Wildlife Sanctuary forming the northern part of the reserve

Gugamal National Park

Gugamal National Park is an Indian national park that is one of seven protected areas in the Melghat Tiger Reserve.Founded on 22 February 1974, this park is located in the Chikhaldara and Dharni tehsils of Amravati, Maharashtra

Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary

Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary is a protected area situated between the northern Sahyadri range and the western coast of India. Though not directly connected to the main Western Ghats range, the biodiversity is similar.

Malvan Marine Sanctuary

Malvan is the southernmost part of the state of Maharashtra, and is located about 35 km from the Mumbai-Goa National Highway No. 17. Malvan Marine Sanctuary is the only marine sanctuary located in Malvan Taluka of Sindhudurg District in the Konkan region of the state

Bhamragarh Wildlife Sanctuary

Spread over an area of about 104.38 sq.km., the sanctuary is very green and is covered by various species from the plant kingdom including mango, jamun, Kusum, Bamboo trees along with shrubs of Neel, Tarota, Kuda, etc.

Karnala Bird Sanctuary

The Karnala Bird Sanctuary is located in Panvel Taluka of Raigad District, outside Mumbai, India near Matheran and Karjat.It is the first bird sanctuary in Maharashtra.

Sagareshwar Deer Sanctuary

Sagareshwar Wildlife Sanctuary is a protected area in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is located at the meeting of three Tehsils of Sangli district: Kadegaon, Walva and Palus.

Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary

Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary was created in the Ambegaon and Khed talukas of Pune District, in the Western Indian state of Maharashtra in order mainly to protect the habitat of the Indian Giant Squirrel

Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary

Dajipur is a small village about 490 km (300 mi) from Mumbai on the road connecting the NH 17 and Kolhapur about 40 km from Radhanagari.

Rehkuri Blackbuck Sanctuary

Located at some 80 kms away from Ahmednagar city in Karjat Taluka in village Rehkuri. Rehkuri is home to the sanctuary of rare and famous animal ‘Indian Black Bucks’.

Nagzira Wildlife Sanctuary

The Nagzira wildlife sanctuary is a miraculously preserved “Green Oasis” in the easternmost part of the Maharashtra State and has a great importance from bio-diversity conservation point of view.

Pench National Park

Pench National Park is a national park in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh and was established in 1975 with an area of 257.26 km2 (99.33 sq mi).

Kanha National Park

Kanha National Park is nestled in the Maikal range of Satpuras in Madhya Pradesh, the heart of India that forms the central Indian highlands.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Malshej Falls

A waterfall is any point in a river or stream where water flows over a vertical drop or a series of steep drops. Waterfalls also occur where meltwater drops over the edge of a tabular iceberg or ice shelf. Waterfalls can be formed in several ways, but the most common method of formation is that a river courses over a top layer of resistant bedrock before falling onto softer rock, which erodes faster, leading to an increasingly high fall. Waterfalls have been studied for their impact on species living in and around them.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Randha Falls

Randha waterfall is located only 3 kilometres away from the centre of Bhandardara near Nashik in Maharashtra. The famous Randha falls is situated just ahead of the Bhandardara dam, another major tourist attraction. Randha falls is located around 11 kilometres away from Wilson Dam, a picnic spot in Bhandaradara. To be precise, Randha waterfalls is situated on the place where Bhandardhara Road begins on the Ghoti – Shirdi Highway. The picturesque Randha waterfall is the must visit place in Bhandardara.Yes, on a lucky day it is possible to see rainbow over Randha waterfalls! It is one of the most beautiful sights ever. The rainbows are often formed here due to the droplets. Told you, Randha falls is a must-see place in Bhandardara.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Umbrella Falls

Umbrella Waterfall is a waterfall located in the Sajikot area of Abbottabad District in the KPK province of Pakistan. It has emerged as a tourist attraction relatively recently. The waterfall is located 27 kilometers from Havelian.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Bhivpuri Falls

Waterfalls are an important factor in determining the distribution of lotic organisms such as fish and aquatic invertebrates, as they may restrict dispersal along streams. The presence or absence of certain species can have cascading ecological effects, and thus cause differences in trophic regimes above and below waterfalls. Certain aquatic plants and insects also specialize in the environment of the waterfall itself.[19][20] A 2012 study of the Agbokim Waterfalls, has suggested that they hold biodiversity to a much higher extent than previously thought.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Tamhini Falls

Waterfalls also affect terrestrial species. They create a small microclimate in their immediate vicinity characterized by cooler temperatures and higher humidity than the surrounding region, which may support diverse communities of mosses and liverworts. Species of these plants may have disjunct population at waterzones far from their core range.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Devkund

Devkund waterfall is located in Bhira Patnus and since it went viral on social media, it has become extremely crowded and dangerous place. Several lives have been lost while amateurs try to visit this place on their own.[citation needed] It is the confluence of three waterfalls and is said to be the origin of Kundalika River. It is about a three-hour trek from base village along the dam backwater and through forest to reach this place known as ‘Devkund’. A major part of the trek goes through some semi-dried forests with the river running parallel and sometimes crisscrossing through the route. A guide is required to be taken during the trek as there is dense forest around. According to the locals, the best period to visit this location is between September to mid November

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Dudhsagar Falls

The falls are located in the Bhagwan Mahaveer Sanctuary and Mollem National Park among the Western Ghats. The falls are a punctuation mark in the journey of the Mandovi River from the Western Ghats to Panjim where it meets the Arabian sea. The area is surrounded by deciduous forests with rich biodiversity. The falls are not particularly spectacular during the dry season but during the monsoon season, the falls are fed by rains and form a huge sheet of water.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Ellora Falls

Waterfall sites more than any other geomorphic feature attract and hold the interest of the general public. Because they have such a popular approval waterfalls are not given serious attention by some students of systematic geomorphology. This attitude is not to be commended. Waterfalls are significant items for geomorphic investigation.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Amboli Falls

Amboli Ghat is a mountain pass in the Sahyadri. The hill station of Amboli lies on this ghat. It’s on the way from Kolhapur to Sawantwadi (via Amboli). This ghat receives heavy rainfall and is surrounded by thick forest, waterfalls and beautiful natural landscape. This ghat is one of the tourist attractions in Maharashtra.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Vihigaon Falls

Waterfalls at least as early as in Ancient Rome and China. However, many waterfalls were essentially inaccessible due to the treacherous terrain surrounding them until improvements began to be made such as paths to the falls, becoming common across the United Kingdom and America in the 1800s and continuing through the 1900s and into the 21st century. Remote waterfalls are now often visited by air travel.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Kalu Falls

Waterfalls at least as early as in Ancient Rome and China. However, many waterfalls were essentially inaccessible due to the treacherous terrain surrounding them until improvements began to be made such as paths to the falls, becoming common across the United Kingdom and America in the 1800s and continuing through the 1900s and into the 21st century. Remote waterfalls are now often visited by air travel.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Dhodi Falls

Human development has also threatened many waterfalls. For instance, the Guaíra Falls, once one of the most powerful waterfalls in the world, were submerged in 1982 by a human-made dam, as were the Ripon Falls in 1952. Conversely, other waterfalls have seen significantly lower water levels as a result of diversion for hydroelectricity, such as the Tyssestrengene in Norway.[42] Development of the areas around falls as tourist attractions has also destroyed the natural scene around many of them.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Vajrai Falls

The Bhambavli Vajrai Waterfall is a waterfall located on the Urmodi river in India.[1] It is approximately 27 kilometres (17 mi) from the city of Satara, Maharashtra,[2] near the village of Bhambavli[3] and Sahyadri Hill.[2] The height of the waterfall combining all three tiers is 260 metres (850 ft),[4] and is the second highest plunge waterfall in India, after the Nohkalikai Falls in Meghalaya, with a drop of 335 metres (1,099 ft).

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Thoseghar Falls

Thoseghar waterfalls is a scenic spot located near the small village of Thoseghar, 20 km from Satara city, at the edge of the Konkan region, in Western India. There are a series of waterfalls, some of them 15 to 20 metres and one of approx 200 metres in height. People come from all over Maharashtra to visit the area, especially during the rainy or monsoon season, July to November. Heavy rain falls during that season and because of this the falls have more water and are more spectacular. The immediate area is calm and quiet, with a clean lake and dark woods in a hilly area.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Kune Falls

The Kune Falls is a waterfall at Lonavla in Pune district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is the 14th highest waterfall in India.Kune Falls, located centrally within the Lonavala Khandala valley[2] is a three tiered waterfalls with a total height of 200 metres (660 ft); the highest drop being 100 metres (330 ft).

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Lingmala Falls

Although one can head towards Lingmala Waterfall at any time of the year, if you wish to soak in its beauty at its peak, then you should plan a getaway to this unspoiled site from July to October. Because this is the time when the level of water is at its peak, making it look even more beautiful and enjoyable. Please do not swim during the monsoon season as it could be dangerous for you and your family members.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Marleshwar Falls

At a distance of 65 km from Ratnagiri, Marleshwar Temple is a cave temple located at Maral village near Sangameshwar in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra. Surrounded by the scenic Sahyadri mountain ranges, Sri Marleshwar Temple is one of the popular pilgrimage places in Maharashtra, and among the most visited Ratnagiri tourist places. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, Marleshwar Temple is one of the famous pilgrimage places to visit near Kolhapur. It is believed that the temple was built by Lord Parashuram. The shrine is most famous for the cobras which are believed to live here with the shivaling and to date have not harmed anyone. This has resulted in increasing faith in the place and every year thousands of devotees visit the place as part of their Ratnagiri tour. This temple is known as the 'Trimbakeshwar' of Konkan. Marleshwar name may have come from Maral village.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Dugarwadi Falls

Dugarwadi is a great place to explore the beauty of mother nature especially in the monsoon season. The dense forest, waterfall and the fresh air are all seductive. It totally makes one forget about all the hustle-bustle, stress and tensions of the city life. During rains take utmost care because the water level rises suddenly. At a distance of 8 km from Trimbakeshwar and 38 km from Nashik, Dugarwadi waterfall is one of the best natural waterfalls of Maharashtra situated near Sapgon. To reach the Dugarwadi falls, visitors need to drive up to Sapgon on NH-848, which is about 4 km from Trimbakeshwar. From Sapgon the waterfall parking area is 4 km. After reaching the place, one has to park the vehicles near the road and a walk of 1-2 km is required to reach at the exact place of waterfall. It is recommended to make group visit at Dugarwadi, because there is no security available and it is also a lonely place.

Page no: 4/4

Video Explaination:

Barki Falls

here are thousands of waterfalls in the world, though no exact number has been calculated. The World Waterfall Database lists 7,827 as of 2013, but this is likely incomplete; as noted by Hudson, over 90% of their listings are in North America.

Page no: 3/4

Gorewada International Zoo

Overview
Gorewada International Zoo, also known as Gorewada Zoo and Wildlife Park, is a zoological park located in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:
location

  • City: Nagpur
  • State: Maharashtra
  • Nearest Airport: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport (20 km)
  • Nearest Railway Station: Nagpur Railway Station (15 km)
Language
  • Marathi (local language)
  • Hindi
  • English
best time to visit
  • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
  • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
Things to do
  • Zoo Visit: Explore animal enclosures
  • Safari: Drive-through wildlife experience
  • Boating: Enjoy lake views
  • Trekking: Hike through forest trails
  • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
Places to visit
  • Gorewada Zoo: Main attraction with various animal enclosures
  • Wildlife Park: Drive-through safari experience
  • Gorewada Lake: Scenic lake with boating options
  • Forest Area: Trekking and hiking trails
  • Butterfly Park: Colorful butterfly garden
Entry Fees
  • Zoo: ₹50 (adults), ₹30 (children)
  • Safari: ₹200 (adults), ₹150 (children)
  • Boating: ₹50 (per person)
Accommodation
  • Budget-friendly hotels
  • Luxury resorts
  • Camping options available
Timings
  • Summer: 9 am to 6 pm
  • Winter: 9 am to 5 pm

Page no: 3/4

Tadoba National Park

Overview
Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve, also known as Tadoba National Park, is a wildlife sanctuary located in Chandrapur District, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:
location

  • District: Chandrapur
  • State: Maharashtra
  • Nearest Airport: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport, Nagpur (140 km)
  • Nearest Railway Station: Chandrapur Railway Station (45 km)
Language
  • Marathi (local language)
  • Hindi
  • English
best time to visit
  • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
  • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
Things to do
  • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours in open-top vehicles
  • Tiger Spotting: Chance to see majestic tigers
  • Birdwatching: Spot rare and endangered species
  • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
  • Nature Walks: Explore park's flora and fauna
Places to visit
  • Tadoba National Park: Core area with tiger sightings
  • Andhari Wildlife Sanctuary: Buffer area with diverse wildlife
  • Tadoba Lake: Scenic lake with birdwatching opportunities
  • Erai Dam: Water source for wildlife
  • Moharli Village: Entry point for park
Entry Fees
  • Indians: ₹50 (adults), ₹30 (children)
  • Foreigners: ₹200 (adults), ₹150 (children)
Accommodation
  • Budget-friendly hotels
  • Luxury resorts
  • Camping options available
Safari Information
  • Timings: Morning (6 am - 10 am), Afternoon (2 pm - 6 pm)
  • Duration: 4 hours
  • Vehicles: Open-top Gypsies or Canter buses
  • Cost: ₹2,500 - ₹3,500 (vehicle rental)

Page no: 3/4

Melghat National Park

Overview
Melghat National Park, located in Amaravati District, Maharashtra, India, is a premier tiger reserve and wildlife destination. Here's essential information for tourists:
location

  • District: Amaravati
  • State: Maharashtra
  • Nearest City: Amaravati (100 km)
  • Nearest Airport: Nagpur Airport (230 km)
  • Nearest Railway Station: Amaravati Railway Station (100 km)
Language
  • Marathi (local language)
  • Hindi
  • English
best time to visit
  • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
  • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
Things to do
  • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours in open-top vehicles
  • Safari: Drive-through wildlife experience
  • Boating: Enjoy lake views
  • Trekking: Hike through forest trails
  • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
Places to visit
  • Melghat National Park: Core area with tiger sightings
  • Melghat Wildlife Sanctuary: Buffer area with diverse wildlife
  • Gugamal Village: Entry point for park
  • Dhakna-Kolkaz Tourism Complex: Accommodation and amenities
  • Wan Wildlife Division: Nearby forest area
Entry Fees
  • Zoo: ₹50 (adults), ₹30 (children)
  • Safari: ₹200 (adults), ₹150 (children)
    • Accommodation
    • Budget-friendly hotels
    • Luxury resorts
    • Camping options available
    Safari Information
    • Timings: Morning (6 am - 10 am), Afternoon (2 pm - 6 pm)
    • Duration: 4 hours
    • Vehicles: Open-top Gypsies or Canter buses
    • Cost: ₹2,500 - ₹3,500 (vehicle rental)

    Amte Animal Ark

    Overview
    Amte's Animal Ark, located in Warora, Chandrapur District, Maharashtra, India, is a unique wildlife sanctuary and rehabilitation center. Here's essential information for tourists:
    location

    • City: Warora
    • State: Maharashtra
    • District: Chandrapur
    • Nearest Airport: Nagpur Airport (120 km)
    • Nearest Railway Station: Warora Railway Station (5 km)
    Language
    • Marathi (local language)
    • Hindi
    • English
    best time to visit
    • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
    • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
    Things to do
    • Guided Tours: Explore animal enclosures and learn about conservation efforts
    • Animal Interactions: Get up close with rescued animals
    • Nature Walks: Discover local flora and fauna
    • Volunteer Opportunities: Participate in animal care and conservation activities
    • Educational Programs: Attend workshops and seminars on wildlife conservation
    Places to visit
    • Animal Enclosures: View rescued animals, including leopards, tigers, bears, and monkeys
    • Wildlife Hospital: Learn about animal care and rehabilitation
    • Nature Trail: Explore surrounding forests and hills
    • Children's Park: Interactive area for kids
    • Dr. Amte Museum: Insights into Dr. Amte's life and work
    Timing and Entry Fees
    • Timings: 9 am - 5 pm
    • Entry Fees: ₹50 (adults), ₹30 (children)
    Accommodation
    • Budget-friendly hotels
    • Luxury resorts
    • Camping options available

    Page no: 3/4

    Detailed View :

    Previous Next

    Rajiv Gandhi Zoological park

    Overview
    Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park, also known as Rajiv Gandhi Zoo, is a zoological park located in Katraj, Pune, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:
    location

    • City: Pune
    • State: Maharashtra
    • Nearest Airport: Pune International Airport (20 km)
    • Nearest Railway Station: Pune Railway Station (15 km)
    Language
    • Marathi (local language)
    • Hindi
    • English
    best time to visit
    • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
    • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
    Things to do
    • Guided Tours: Explore animal enclosures and learn about conservation efforts
    • Animal Encounters: Get up close with selected animals
    • Snake Show: Watch live snake demonstrations
    • Birdwatching: Spot over 100 bird species
    • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
    Places to visit
    • Animal Enclosures: View mammals, birds, reptiles, and amphibians
    • Snake Park: Showcase of venomous and non-venomous snakes
    • Wildlife Adoption Center: Adopt animals for conservation
    • Children's Park: Play area with educational activities
    • Mini Train: Scenic ride through the park
    Timing and Entry Fees
    • Timings: 9:30 am - 5:00 pm (April-September), 9:30 am - 4:30 pm (October-March)
    • EEntry Fees:
    • - Adults: ₹50
    • - Children (5-12 years): ₹30
    • - Children (below 5 years): Free/li>
    Accommodation
    • Budget-friendly hotels
    • Luxury resorts
    • Camping options available

    Page no: 3/4

    Veermata Jijabai Bhosale Botanical Udyan and Zoo

    Overview
    Veermata Jijabai Bhosale Zoo, also known as Byculla Zoo or Mumbai Zoo, is one of the oldest zoos in India, located in Byculla, Mumbai, Maharashtra.
    General Information

    • Established: 1861
    • Spread over: 48 acres
    • Home to: 1,000+ animals from 150 species
    • Conservation and education efforts
    Main Attractions
    • 1. Penguin Enclosurer
    • 2. Elephant Enclosure
    • 3. Lion and Tiger Enclosures
    • 4. Children's Zoo
    • 5. Zoo Lake with Boating
    • 6. Jijamata Temple
    Facilities
    • 1. Guided Tours
    • 2. Animal Encounters
    • 3. Elephant Rides (subject to availability)
    • 4. Boat Rides
    • 5. Photography
    • 6. Food Stalls and Restaurants
    Language
    • Marathi (local language)
    • Hindi
    • English
    best time to visit
    • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
    • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
    Places to visit
    • Mumbai City
    • Gateway of India
    • Elephanta Caves
    • Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (CSMVS) Museum
    • Marine Drive
    Timing and Entry Fees
    • Timings: 9:30 am - 5:00 pm (April-September), 9:30 am - 4:30 pm (October-March)
    • EEntry Fees:
    • - Adults: ₹50
    • - Children (5-12 years): ₹30
    • - Children (below 5 years): Free/li>
    Accommodation
    • Budget-friendly hotels
    • Luxury resorts
    • Camping options available

    Chandoli National Park

    Overview
    Chandoli National Park, located in Sangli and Kolhapur districts of Maharashtra, India, is a protected area known for its rich biodiversity and scenic beauty.
    location

    • Districts: Sangli and Kolhapur
    • State: Maharashtra
    • Nearest City: Kolhapur (60 km)
    • Nearest Airport: Kolhapur Airport (65 km)
    • Nearest Railway Station: Sangli Railway Station (50 km)
    Language
    • Marathi (local language)
    • Hindi
    • English
    best time to visit
    • Winter season (October to February) for pleasant weather
    • Summer season (March to May) for wildlife spotting
    Things to do
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours in open-top vehicles
    • Safari: Drive-through wildlife experience
    • Boating: Enjoy lake views
    • Trekking: Hike through forest trails
    • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
    Places to visit
    • Chandoli Dam: Scenic views and water sports
    • Kalavantin Point: Panoramic views of surrounding hills
    • Kowad Village: Local culture and handicrafts
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours to spot wildlife
    Entry Fees
    • Indians: ₹50 (adults), ₹30 (children)
    • Foreigners: ₹200 (adults), ₹150 (children)
    Accommodation
    • Budget-friendly hotels
    • Luxury resorts
    • Camping options available
    Safari Information
    • Timings: Morning (6 am - 10 am), Afternoon (2 pm - 6 pm)
    • Duration: 4 hours
    • Vehicles: Open-top Gypsies or Canter buses
    • Cost: ₹2,500 - ₹3,500 (vehicle rental)

    Page no: 3/4

    Detailed View :

    Gugamal National Park

    Overview
    Gugamal National Park, located in Amravati District, Maharashtra, India, is a protected area known for its rich biodiversity and wildlife.
    location

    • District: Amravati
    • State: Maharashtra
    • Nearest City: Amravati (100 km)

    • Marathi (local language)
    • Hindi
    • English

    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours in open-top vehicles

    • Boating: Enjoy lake views
    • Trekking: Hike through forest trails
    • Photography: Capture wildlife moments
    Places to visit
    • Gugamal National Park: Core area with wildlife sightings
    • Melghat Tiger Reserve: Adjacent reserve with tiger spotting
    • Wan Wildlife Sanctuary: Nearby sanctuary with diverse wildlife
    • Dhakna-Kolkaz Tourism Centre: Scenic views and accommodations

    Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary

    Location
    Murud, Raigad District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary is a coastal sanctuary protecting diverse flora, fauna, and avifauna.
    Key Attractions
    • Birdlife: Over 700 species, including migratory birds.
    • Coastal Ecosystem: Mangroves, beaches, and estuaries.
    • Wildlife: Leopards, sloth bears, hyenas, and deer.
    • Butterflies: 100+ species.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 5:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to May

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 120 km from Mumbai (2.5 hours)
    • By Train: Roha Railway Station (40 km)

    Activities
    • Birdwatching: Guided tours
    • Nature Trails: Explore coastal forests
    • Butterfly Watching
    • Boat Rides: Estuary cruises

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring binoculars, field guides, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife habitats.

    Nearby Attractions:
    • Murud Beach (10 km)
    • Janjira Fort (20 km)
    • Alibaug (40 km)
    • Mumbai (120 km)

    Accommodation
    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    Conservation Efforts
    • Habitat restoration
    • Bird conservation program
    • Anti-poaching initiatives

    Detailed View :

    Previous Next

    Malvan Marine Sanctuary

    Location
    Malvan, Sindhudurg District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Malvan Marine Sanctuary protects coral reefs, mangroves, and marine life along the Malvan coastline.
    Key Attractions
    • Coral Reefs: Vibrant coral formations.
    • Marine Life: Dolphins, sea turtles, and colorful fish.
    • Mangrove Forests: Protective habitat for aquatic species.
    • Beaches: Clean, pristine beaches like Tarkarli and Chivla.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to May

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 535 km from Mumbai (8.5 hours).
    • By Train: Kudal Railway Station (35 km).
    • By Air: Dabolim Airport, Goa (120 km).

    Activities
    • Snorkeling: Explore coral reefs.
    • Scuba Diving: Dive into the Arabian Sea.
    • Boat Rides: Sunset cruises and dolphin-watching.
    • Fishing: Traditional fishing experiences.

    Tips
    • Wear suitable clothing and footwear.
    • Bring sunscreen and water.
    • Respect marine life and habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Tarkarli Beach (5 km)
    • Sindhudurg Fort (10 km)
    • Chivla Beach (15 km)
    • Devbagh Beach (20 km)

    Accommodation
    • MTDC Resorts
    • Private beach resorts and hotels

    Detailed View :

    Previous Next

    Bhamragarh Wildlife Sanctuary

    Location
    Chandrapur District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Bhamragarh Wildlife Sanctuary protects diverse flora and fauna, including endangered species.
    Key Attractions
    • Tiger Reserve: Home to majestic Bengal tigers.
    • Wildlife: Leopards, sloth bears, hyenas, and deer.
    • Birdlife: Over 150 species, including peafowl and eagles.
    • Forests: Lush teak and bamboo forests.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: November to June

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 120 km from Chandrapur (2.5 hours).
    • By Train: Chandrapur Railway Station.

    Activities
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours.
    • Trekking: Explore surrounding forests.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife and their habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Bhamragarh Fort (5 km)
    • Chandrapur (120 km)
    • Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (150 km)

    Accommodation
    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    Conservation Efforts
    • Tiger conservation program
    • Habitat restoration
    • Anti-poaching initiatives

    Karnala Bird Sanctuary

    Location
    Raigad District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Karnala Bird Sanctuary is a haven for birdwatchers, protecting over 220 species of resident and migratory birds.
    Key Attractions
    • Diverse Birdlife: Spot rare species like Malabar Trogon and Oriental Honey-buzzard.
    • Karnala Fort: 14th-century historic fort within the sanctuary.
    • Nature Trails: Guided walks through lush forests.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 5:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to April

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 60 km from Mumbai (1.5 hours).
    • By Train: Panvel Railway Station (35 km).

    Activities
    • Birdwatching: Guided tours.
    • Trekking: Explore Karnala Fort.
    • Nature Photography.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable shoes and clothing.
    • Bring binoculars and field guides.
    • Respect bird habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Karnala Fort (1 km)
    • Panvel (35 km)
    • Alibaug (50 km)
    • Mumbai (60 km)

    Accommodation
    • MTDC Resorts
    • Private hotels and resorts

    Special Events
    • Bird Festival (January)
    • Migration Period (October to April)

    Detailed View :

    Sagareshwar Deer Sanctuary

    Location
    Kolhapur District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Sagareshwar Deer Sanctuary protects endangered deer species and other wildlife in a lush forest ecosystem.
    Key Attractions
    • Deer Species: Chinkara, Sambar, and Barking Deer.
    • Other Wildlife: Leopards, sloth bears, and various bird species.
    • Forests: Diverse vegetation, including teak and bamboo.
    • Waterfalls: Seasonal waterfalls within the sanctuary.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to May
    • Area: 10.87 sq
    • Elevation: 600-800 meters above sea level
    • Note: Open throughout the year, but best visited during monsoon (June-Sept) for lush greenery.

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 45 km from Kolhapur (1 hour).
    • By Train: Kolhapur Railway Station.

    Activities
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours.
    • Trekking: Explore surrounding forests.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Kolhapur City (45 km)
    • Panhala Fort (60 km)
    • Mahalaxmi Temple (50 km)
    • Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary (100 km)

    Accommodation
    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    Conservation Efforts
    • Deer conservation program
    • Habitat restoration
    • Anti-poaching initiatives

    Detailed View :

    Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary

    Location
    Pune District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary is a protected area, home to the sacred Jyotirlinga temple of Bhimashankar and diverse flora and fauna.
    Key Attractions
    • Bhimashankar Temple: Ancient Shiva temple and Jyotirlinga.
    • Western Ghat Biodiversity: Rich flora, including medicinal plants.
    • Wildlife: Indian giant squirrels, leopards, hyenas, and various bird species.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to March

    How to Reach
    • By Road: 110 km from Pune (2.5 hours).
    • By Train: Pune Railway Station.

    Activities
    • Trekking: Explore surrounding hills and forests.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.
    • Nature Photography.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable shoes and clothing.
    • Carry water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect local environment and wildlife.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Bhimashankar Forest Trail (5 km)
    • Hanuman Lake (10 km)
    • Sahyadri Hills (20 km)
    • Pune City (110 km)

    Accommodation
    • Bhimashankar Forest Rest House
    • Private resorts and hotels in nearby villages

    Detailed View :

    Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary

    Location
    Kolhapur District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary protects diverse flora and fauna, including endangered species.
    Key Attractions
    • Bison Sanctuary: Conservation efforts for Indian bison.
    • Wildlife: Leopards, sloth bears, deer, and various bird species.
    • Radhanagari Dam: Scenic views and water sports.
    • Lush Forests: Tropical deciduous and evergreen forests.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to May
    • Area: 51.73 sq km
    • Elevation: 500-800 meters above sea level
    • Note: Best visited during monsoon (June-Sept) for lush greenery.

    How to Reach
    • By Road: From Kolhapur: 80 km (2 hours)
    • By Train: Kolhapur Railway Station (80 km) or Radhanagari Railway Station (20 km)
    • By Air: Kolhapur Airport (80 km)

    Public Transportation
    • State Transport buses from Kolhapur, Pune, and Mumbai
    • Private bus operators

    Activities
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours.
    • Trekking: Explore surrounding forests.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Radhanagari Dam (10 km)
    • Kolhapur City (80 km)
    • Panhala Fort (100 km)
    • Sagareshwar Deer Sanctuary (120 km)

    Accommodation
    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    Conservation Efforts
    • Bison conservation program
    • Habitat restoration
    • Anti-poaching initiatives

    Detailed View :

    Rehkuri Blackbuck Sanctuary

    Location
    Ahmednagar District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Rehkuri Blackbuck Sanctuary protects the endangered blackbuck and other wildlife in a grassland ecosystem.
    Key Attractions
    • Blackbucks: Endangered antelope species.
    • Other Wildlife: Wolves, hyenas, and various bird species.
    • Grasslands: Unique ecosystem with diverse vegetation.
    • Watchtowers: Elevated views of the sanctuary.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: October to May

    How to Reach
    • By Road: From Ahmednagar: 120 km (2.5 hours) or From Pune: 220 km (4.5 hours) or From Mumbai: 320 km (6 hours)
    • By Train: Ahmednagar Railway Station (120 km) or Kopargaon Railway Station (150 km)
      • By Air: Pune Airport (220 km) or Aurangabad Airport (180 km)

    Public Transportation
    • State Transport buses from Ahmednagar, Pune, and Mumbai
    • Private bus operators

    Private Vehicle
    • Nearest fuel station: Ahmednagar (120 km)
    • Parking available within the sanctuary

    Activities
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.
    • Nature Photography.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Ahmednagar Fort (120 km)
    • Shirdi Sai Baba Temple (150 km)
    • Mehekari Dam (50 km)
    • Davdi Dam (70 km)

    Accommodation
    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    Conservation Efforts
    • Blackbuck conservation program
    • Habitat restoration
    • Anti-poaching initiatives

    Detailed View :

    Nagzira Wildlife Sanctuary

    Location
    Gondia District, Maharashtra, India

    Overview
    Nagzira Wildlife Sanctuary protects diverse flora and fauna, including endangered species.
    Key Attractions
    • Tiger Reserve: Home to majestic Bengal tigers.
    • Wildlife: Leopards, sloth bears, deer, and various bird species.
    • Lush Forests: Tropical deciduous and evergreen forests.
    • Waterfalls: Seasonal waterfalls within the sanctuary.

    Tourist Information
    • Timing: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
    • Entry Fee: ₹50 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners)
    • Best Time to Visit: November to June
    • Area: 152.81 sq km
    • Elevation: 200-400 meters above sea level
    • Note: Best visited during dawn or dusk for optimal wildlife spotting.

    How to Reach
    • By Road: From Gondia: 22 km (30 minutes) or From Nagpur: 120 km (2.5 hours)
    • By Train: Gondia Railway Station (22 km) or Nagpur Railway Station (120 km)
    • By Air: Nagpur Airport (120 km) or Raipur Airport (200 km)

    Public Transportation
    • State Transport buses from Gondia, Nagpur, and Mumbai
    • Private bus operators

    Activities
    • Wildlife Safari: Guided tours.
    • Trekking: Explore surrounding forests.
    • Birdwatching: Spot rare species.

    Tips
    • Wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
    • Bring water, snacks, and sun protection.
    • Respect wildlife habitats.

    Nearby Attractions
    • Nagzira Lake (5 km)
    • Itiadoh Dam (20 km)
    • Gondia City (22 km)
    • Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (150 km)

    • Forest Rest Houses
    • Private resorts and hotels

    • Tiger conservation program
    • Habitat restoration
    • Anti-poaching initiatives
