                Igatpuri Hill Station

                Overview
                Igatpuri is a scenic hill station in Maharashtra, India, known for its breathtaking natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere. Here's essential information for tourists:

                Location
                Igatpuri is situated in the Nashik district of Maharashtra, approximately 130 km from Mumbai and 45 km from Nashik.
                Best Time to Visit
                • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                Tips and Essentials
                • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                • Water: Stay hydrated.
                • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                Places to visit
                • Bhatsa River Valley: Scenic views, trekking, and camping.
                • Camel Valley: Picturesque valley with waterfalls.
                • Tringalwadi Fort: Historic fort with stunning views.
                • Igatpuri Lake: Serene lake for boating and relaxation.
                • Vihigaon Waterfall: Breathtaking waterfall, ideal for swimming.
                Things to Do
                • Trekking
                • Hiking
                • Boating
                • Fishing
                Accommodation
                • Hotels
                • Resorts
                • Guesthouses
                • Homestays
                • Camping
                  • Food
                  • Local Maharashtrian cuisine: Try misal pav, vada pav, and poha.
                  • Street food: Enjoy snacks and refreshments.
                  • Restaurants: Savor Indian, Chinese, and Continental cuisine.
                  How to reach
                  • By Train: Igatpuri Railway Station (Central Railway).
                  • By Bus: Regular buses from Mumbai, Nashik, and Pune.
                  • By Car: Drive via NH3 (Mumbai-Agra Highway).

                  Page no: 3/4

                  Detailed View :

                  Previous Next

                  Lavasa Hill station

                  Overview
                  Lavasa is a planned hill station in Maharashtra, India, known for its picturesque landscape, serene atmosphere, and modern amenities.

                  Location
                  Lavasa is situated in the Pune district of Maharashtra, approximately 65 km from Pune city.
                  Altitude
                  649 meters (2,129 feet) above sea level
                  Best Time to Visit
                  • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                  • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                  • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                  Tips and Essentials
                  • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                  • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                  • Water: Stay hydrated.
                  • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                  Places to visit
                  • Lakeside Promenade: Scenic waterfront with shopping and dining.
                  • Lavasa Lake: Boating and water sports.
                  • Temghar Dam: Picnic spot with scenic views.
                  • Vortex Water Park: Thrilling water rides.
                  • Dasve Village: Explore local culture and handicrafts.
                  Things to Do
                  • Trekking
                  • Hiking
                  • Boating
                  • Fishing
                  Accommodation
                  • Hotels
                  • Resorts
                  • Guesthouses
                  • Homestays
                  • Camping
                    • Food
                    • Multi-cuisine restaurants: Indian, Chinese, Italian, and more.
                    • Street food: Enjoy snacks and refreshments.
                    • Bakeries: Fresh pastries and bread.
                    How to reach
                    • By Car: Drive via Mumbai-Pune Highway (NH4).
                    • By Bus: Regular buses from Pune, Mumbai, and other nearby cities.
                    • By Train: Pune Railway Station (25 km from Lavasa).

                    Page no: 3/4

                    Detailed View :

                    Previous Next

                    Koroli Hill station

                    Overview
                    Koroli is a lesser-known hill station in Maharashtra, India, offering a serene and peaceful getaway. Here's essential information for tourists:

                    Location
                    Koroli is situated in the Ahmednagar district of Maharashtra, approximately 120 km from Pune and 220 km from Mumbai.
                    Altitude
                    1,036 meters (3,399 feet) above sea level
                    Best Time to Visit
                    • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                    • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                    • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                    Tips and Essentials
                    • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                    • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                    • Water: Stay hydrated.
                    • SLanguage: Marathi, Hindi, and English are spoken.
                    Places to visit
                    • Koroli Fort: Historic fort with stunning views.
                    • Dhodap Fort: Ancient fort with scenic surroundings.
                    • Kalsubai Peak: Highest peak in Maharashtra (1646 m).
                    • Wilson Dam: Picnic spot with scenic views.
                    • Randha Falls: Breathtaking waterfall.
                    Things to Do
                    • Trekking
                    • Hiking
                    • Boating
                    • Horse Riding
                    • Fishing
                    • Birdwatching: Spot local bird species.
                    Accommodation
                    • Budget-friendly hotels and lodges.
                    • Homestays: Cozy, local experiences.
                    • Camping: Pitch tents at designated campsites.
                      • Food
                      • Local Maharashtrian cuisine: Try misal pav, vada pav, and poha.
                      • Street food: Enjoy snacks and refreshments.
                      • Restaurants: Savor Indian and Chinese cuisine.
                      How to reach
                      • By Car: Drive via Pune-Ahmednagar Highway (NH222).
                      • By Bus: Regular buses from Pune, Ahmednagar, and nearby cities.
                      • By Train: Ahmednagar Railway Station (40 km from Koroli).

                      Page no: 3/4

                      Detailed View :

                      Previous Next

                      Jawhar Hill station

                      Overview
                      Jawhar Hill Station is a hidden gem in Maharashtra, known for its breathtaking waterfalls, lush green forests, and ancient forts. Located in the Palghar district, Jawhar offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, culture, and adventure.

                      Location
                      Jawhar, Palghar district, Maharashtra, India
                      Altitude
                      518 meters (1,699 feet) above sea level
                      Best Time to Visit
                      • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                      • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                      • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                      Tips and Essentials
                      • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                      • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                      • Water: Stay hydrated.
                      • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                      Places to visit
                      • Jawhar Fort: Historic fort with stunning views
                      • Dabhosa Waterfall: Breathtaking waterfall (100 feet)
                      • Kalmandvi Waterfall: Scenic waterfall
                      • Shirpamal: Ancient temple and scenic viewpoint
                      • Hanuman Point: Panoramic views of the valley
                      Things to Do
                      • Trekking
                      • Hiking
                      • Boating
                      • Fishing
                      Accommodation
                      • Hotels
                      • Resorts
                      • Guesthouses
                      • Homestays
                      • Camping
                        • Food
                        • Multi-cuisine restaurants: Indian, Chinese, Italian, and more.
                        • Street food: Enjoy snacks and refreshments.
                        • Bakeries: Fresh pastries and bread.
                        How to reach
                        • By Car: Mumbai-Ahmedabad Highway (NH8)
                        • By Bus: Regular buses from Mumbai, Nashik, nearby cities
                        • By Train: Igatpuri Railway Station (40 km from Jawhar)

                        Amboli Hill station

                        Overview
                        Amboli is a scenic hill station in Maharashtra, India, known for its lush green forests, rolling hills, and waterfalls. It's a popular weekend getaway from Mumbai, Pune, and Goa.

                        Amboli, Sindhudurg District, Maharashtra, India

                        • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                        Tips and Essentials

                          Previous Next

                          Rajmachi Hill Station

                          Overview
                          Rajmachi Hill Station is a scenic destination in the Sahyadri Mountains of Maharashtra, known for its stunning valleys, waterfalls, and historic forts. Located near Lonavala, Rajmachi offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, adventure, and cultural experiences.

                          Location
                          Rajmachi, Pune district, Maharashtra, India
                          Altitude
                          915 meters (3,002 feet) above sea level
                          Best Time to Visit
                          • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                          • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                          • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                          Tips and Essentials
                          • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                          • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                          • Water: Stay hydrated.
                          • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                          Places to visit
                          • Shrivardhan Fort: Ancient fort with scenic surroundings
                          • Rajmachi Fort: Historic fort with stunning views
                          • Manaranjan Fort: Historic fort with breathtaking views
                          • Kondhane Caves: Ancient Buddhist caves
                          • Rajmachi Waterfall: Scenic waterfall
                          Things to Do
                          • Trekking
                          • Hiking
                          • Boating
                          • Fishing
                          Accommodation
                          • Hotels
                          • Resorts
                          • Guesthouses
                          • Homestays
                          • Camping
                            • Food
                            • Local Maharashtrian cuisine: Misal pav, vada pav, poha
                            • Street food: Local snacks and refreshments
                            • Restaurants: Indian and Chinese cuisine
                            How to reach
                            • By Car: Mumbai-Pune Highway (NH4)
                            • By Bus: Regular buses from Mumbai, Pune, Lonavala
                            • By Train: Lonavala Railway Station (15 km from Rajmachi)

                            Page no: 3/4

                            Detailed View :

                            Previous Next

                            Malshej Ghat

                            Overview
                            Malshej Ghat is a breathtaking hill station in the Western Ghats of Maharashtra, known for its stunning valleys, waterfalls, and trekking trails. Located near Pune and Mumbai, Malshej Ghat offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, adventure, and relaxation.

                            Location
                            Malshej Ghat, Pune district, Maharashtra, India
                            Altitude
                            700-1,000 meters (2,300-3,300 feet) above sea level
                            Best Time to Visit
                            • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                            • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                            • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                            Tips and Essentials
                            • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                            • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                            • Water: Stay hydrated.
                            • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                            Places to visit
                            • Malshej Falls: Breathtaking waterfall
                            • Harishchandragad Fort: Historic fort with stunning views
                            • Pimpalgaon Joga Dam: Scenic dam and picnic spot
                            • Ajoba Hill: Trekking trail with stunning views
                            • Malshej Ghat Viewpoint: Panoramic views of the valley
                            Things to Do
                            • Trekking
                            • Hiking
                            • Boating
                            • Fishing
                            Accommodation
                            • Hotels
                            • Resorts
                            • Guesthouses
                            • Homestays
                            • Camping
                            Food
                            • Local Maharashtrian cuisine: Misal pav, vada pav, poha
                            • Street food: Local snacks and refreshments
                            • Restaurants: Indian and Chinese cuisine
                            How to reach
                            • By Car: Mumbai-Pune Highway (NH4)
                            • By Bus: Regular buses from Mumbai, Pune, Lonavala
                            • By Train: Kalyan Railway Station (60 km from Malshej Ghat)

                            Page no: 3/4

                            Detailed View :

                            Previous Next

                            Bhimashankar Hill Station

                            Overview
                            Bhimashankar is a revered Hindu pilgrimage site and a stunning hill station in the Sahyadri Mountains of Maharashtra. It's famous for the Bhimashankar Temple, one of the 12 Jyotirlingas in India, and its breathtaking natural beauty.

                            Location
                            Bhimashankar, Pune district, Maharashtra, India
                            Altitude
                            1,040 meters (3,412 feet) above sea level
                            Best Time to Visit
                            • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                            • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                            • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.
                            Tips and Essentials
                            • Weather: Pack accordingly (umbrella, sunscreen, etc.).
                            • Footwear: Comfortable shoes for trekking.
                            • Water: Stay hydrated.
                            • Safety: Follow local guidelines and instructions.
                            Places to visit
                            • Bhimashankar Temple: Sacred Jyotirlinga shrine
                            • Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary: Home to rare flora and fauna
                            • Hanuman Lake: Scenic lake with boating facilities
                            • Gupt Bhimashankar: Ancient temple and cave
                            • Sahyadri Valley: Panoramic views of the valley
                            Things to Do
                            • Trekking
                            • Hiking
                            • Boating
                            • Fishing

                            • Hotels

                            • Guesthouses

                              Kalsubai Hill Station

                              Overview
                              Kalsubai is a scenic hill station in the Ahmednagar district of Maharashtra, known for its stunning natural beauty, trekking trails, and breathtaking views. It's home to the highest peak in Maharashtra (1,646 meters).

                              Location
                              Kalsubai, Ahmednagar district, Maharashtra, India
                              Altitude
                              1,646 meters (5,400 feet) above sea level
                              Best Time to Visit
                              • Monsoon (June to September): Enjoy lush greenery and waterfalls.
                              • Winter (October to February): Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.
                              • Summer (March to May): Warm weather, suitable for relaxation.

                              • Amruteshwar Temple: Ancient temple with stunning views

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Mahabaleshwar Hill Station

                              Mahabaleshwar is located on the mountainous Sahyadri range of the Western Ghats that run North to south along the western coast of India. The coordinates of the town are 17.9250°N 73.6575°E. Mahabaleshwar is a vast plateau measuring 150 km2 (58 sq mi), bound by valleys on all sides. It reaches a height of 1,439 m (4,721 ft) at its highest peak above sea level, known as Wilson/Sunrise Point. The town is about 122 km (76 mi) southwest of Pune and 285 km (177 mi) from Mumbai. Mahabaleshwar comprises three villages: Malcolm Peth, Old "Kshetra" Mahabaleshwar, and part of the Shindola village. The Mahabaleshwar region is the source of the Krishna River that flows east across Maharashtra, Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh towards the Bay of Bengal. Three tributaries of Krishna, namely Koyna, Venna (Veni) and Gayatri, also have their source in Mahabaleshwar region. A fourth river, the Savitri, also has its source in the region, but flows Westward via Mahad to the Arabian Sea.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Lonavala

                              Lonavala-Khandala is a hill station and a Municipal Council in the Pune district, Maharashtra, India. It is about 64 km (40 miles) west of Pune and 96 km (60 miles) to the east of Mumbai. It is known for its production of the hard candy chikki and is also a major stop on the railway line connecting Mumbai and Pune. From the Pune suburbs, local trains are available from Pune Junction. The Mumbai-Pune Expressway and the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway both pass through Lonavala. Lonavala is also home to INS Shivaji (formerly HMIS Shivaji), the Indian Navy's premier technical training institute. On 16 Feb 1945, the Establishment was commissioned as HMIS Shivaji and since then, the premier Technical Training Establishment of the Indian Navy trains officers.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Matheran

                              Matheran is an automobile-free hill station and a municipal council in the Karjat taluka of the Raigad district located in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Matheran is part of the Mumbai Metropolitan Region, and one of the smallest hill stations in India. It is located in the Western Ghats, at an elevation of around 800 m (2,625 feet) above sea level. It is about 90 km from Mumbai, and 120 km from Pune. This proximity to these urban areas makes it a weekend getaway for many. Matheran, which means "forest on the forehead" (of the mountains) in Marathi, is an eco-sensitive region, declared by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Government of India. It is Asia's only automobile-free hill station

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Khandala

                              Khandala is a hill station and a Municipal Council in the Pune district, Maharashtra, India. It is about 64 km (40 miles) west of Pune and 96 km (60 miles) to the east of Mumbai. It is known for its production of the hard candy chikki and is also a major stop on the railway line connecting Mumbai and Pune. From the Pune suburbs, local trains are available from Pune Junction. The Mumbai-Pune Expressway and the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway both pass through Lonavala.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Panchgani

                              Panchgani was developed by the British during the British Raj as a summer resort under the supervision of Lord John Chesson in the 1860s. Panchgani was developed as a retirement place because its climate remained pleasant throughout the year. He surveyed the hills of this region with Rustomji Dubash, and finally decided on this nameless area around the five villages: Dandeghar, Godavali, Ambral, Khingar, and Taighat. The place was aptly named Panchgani, meaning "land between five villages", and Chesson was made superintendent. To develop the infrastructure, Chesson encouraged various professionals - tailors, dhobis, butchers, vegetable vendors, building contractors - to also settle in Panchgani. The area below the bazaar was allotted to them, and is now known as the gaothan. He is credited with planting plant species from the western world in Panchgani, including silver oak and poinsettia, which have flourished since then in Panchgani.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Igatpuri

                              Igatpuri (Pronunciation: [iɡət̪puɾiː]; formerly known as Egutpoora) is a town and a Hill Station. It is also a municipal council in Nashik District in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is located in the Western Ghats. Igatpuri railway station lies in Nashik District, between Mumbai and Nashik Road on the Central Railway. Igatpuri is known for Vipassana International Academy, where ancient techniques of meditation is taught called Vipassana. The place is one of the best places to visit in Maharashtra in monsoon. It is a hill station on busy Mumbai-Agra NH-3 only 45 km from Nashik and 130 km from Mumbai. Igatpuri railway station is a major railway station connecting Igatpuri to Mumbai. The station is known for its surrounding scenery, wada pao and idlis sold by vendors to commuters traveling in the train.[citation needed] The exit of Igatpuri railway station signals the proximity of Mumbai on the down route.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Lavasa

                              Lavasa (Marathi: लवासा, lavāsā) is a private, planned city built near Pune, India. It is stylistically based on the Italian town Portofino, with a street and several buildings bearing the name of that town. A 100-square-kilometre (39 sq mi) or 32-square-kilometre (12 sq mi) project being developed by HCC, this as-yet-incomplete city has been controversial for multiple reasons including procurement of land, harm to the environment, and loans acquired through political corruption. In late 2010, the Indian Environment and Forests Ministry ordered that construction cease because the project violated environmental laws.[8] As of late 2011, this order has been rescinded. The project's scale may have been reduced, however, and an initial public offering may not occur. As of 2023, a resolution plan has been approved by the National Company Law Tribunal, with Darwin Platform Infrastructure Ltd being declared as the successful bidder responsible for the city's construction.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Koroli

                              A pristine hill station known for its charms, Koroli Hills is a place that will bring you closer to nature. The hill station is about 3 hours away from Shirdi, and is just what you need if you are looking for a place to relax. It is surrounded by the Sahyadri Mountains, and is home to some lovely villas and apartments. It is really heaven on earth, and you will not want to miss out on this place. A perfect place for adventure lovers, nature lovers, and those who are interested in hiking and trekking, Koroli Hills is one of the most unique destinations with a lot to offer.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Jawhar

                              Jawhar is a city and a municipal council in Palghar district of Maharashtra state in Konkan division of India. Jawhar was a capital city of the erstwhile Koli princely state of Jawhar. Situated in the ranges of the Western Ghats, Jawhar is known for its picturesque setting and a vibrant cultural heritage. It is one of the few remaining tribal regions of Maharashtra and is known for its vibrant Warli painting that are a characteristic landmark of this place. Established in 1918, Jawhar is one of the oldest municipal councils in the state of Maharashtra and tourist spot near Mumbai.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Amboli Hill Station

                              Amboli is a small village in the southern Konkan Division, Sindhudurg district, Maharashtra state, India. Amboli Ghat lies at an altitude of approximately 700 metres (2,300 feet) above sea level and is the last hill resort before ending in the coastal plains of Goa state. Amboli lies in the Western Ghats of peninsular India, one of the world's "Ecological Hotspots"[citation needed] and it abounds in unusual flora and fauna. However, as in the other parts of the Sahaydri Hills, denudation of the forest cover and unregulated government-assisted development are gradually ruining a once-pristine environment. Historically, Amboli village came into being as one of the staging posts along the road from Vengurla port to the city of Belgaum, which was extensively used by the British to supply their garrisons in south and central India.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Rajmachi Hill Station

                              Rajmachi Trek is nestled in the midst of two popular hill stations – Lonavala and Karjat. The trek can be approached either via the Lonavala side or the Karjat side and offers trekkers to climb two forts starting from the same base village of Udhewadi.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Malshej Ghat Hill Station

                              Malshej Ghat is a mountain pass in India's Maharashtra state that is part of the Western Ghats Range. Some of the many species of birds that call this area home are quails, cuckoos and flamingos. Beautiful waterfalls and lush valleys await exploration in the nearby highlands.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Bhimashankar Hill Station

                              Endowed with religious opulence, Bhimashankar hill station is richly enveloped in some ethereal pulchritude of nature and is rightfully termed as one of the popular hill stations in Mumbai. Perched on the elevated height of 3200ft above sea level, the hill station is enshrouded with the sylvan forest and thick foliage of trees.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Bhandardara Hill Station

                              Bhandardara, a hill station nestled in the Sahyadri ranges of Maharashtra, has all the nature's blessings a place can get. The lush greenery, the humble waterfalls and surrounded by high mountains makes for the perfect holiday spot for city dwellers.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Chikhaldara Hill Station

                              Chikhaldara is situated in Amaravati District. Situated on the ranges of Satpura at the height of 1118 mtrs. According to a legend Bheema killed the villainous Keechaka & threw him in to the valley, so this place came to be known as Keechakdara, and later Chikhaldara.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Amba Ghat Hill Station

                              The location Amba Ghat is quite well known for its beautiful natural surrounding and pleasant cool weather. This is the reason large number of national and international tourists are visiting this tourist centre almost in every season. Its height from sea level is 2000 ft.It is located on Kolhapur-Ratnagiri national highway (NH-204) and this is the highest spot in Kolhapur district. Region beyond this is Konkan.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Amboli

                              Amboli is a small village in the southern Konkan Division, Sindhudurg district, Maharashtra state, India. Amboli Ghat lies at an altitude of approximately 700 metres (2,300 feet) above sea level and is the last hill resort before ending in the coastal plains of Goa state. Amboli lies in the Western Ghats of peninsular India, one of the world's "Ecological Hotspots"[citation needed] and it abounds in unusual flora and fauna. However, as in the other parts of the Sahaydri Hills, denudation of the forest cover and unregulated government-assisted development are gradually ruining a once-pristine environment. Historically, Amboli village came into being as one of the staging posts along the road from Vengurla port to the city of Belgaum, which was extensively used by the British to supply their garrisons in south and central India.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Panhala Hill Station

                              Panhala is a city and a Hill station Municipal Council 18 km northwest of Kolhapur, in Kolhapur district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Panhala is the smallest city in Maharashtra and being a Municipal Council the city is developing rapidly.

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Kalsubai Hill Station

                              Kalsubai is a mountain in the Western Ghats, located in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Kalsubai is the highest peak in Maharashtra and is located in Ahmednagar district in Akole Taluka. Its summit, situated at an elevation of 1,646 metres (5,400 ft), is the highest point in Maharashtra and hence it is known as the "Everest of Maharashtra".

                              Page no: 4/4

                              Video Explaination:

                              Phonda Hill Station

                              Phondaghat is a large village located in Kankavli Taluka of Sindhudurg district, Maharashtra with total 1526 families residing. The Phondaghat village has population of 6299 of which 3091 are males while 3208 are females as per Population Census 2011.

                              Page no: 2/4

                              Maharastra Beaches:

                              Tarkarli Beach

                              Tarkarli is a village in Malvan taluka in Sindhudurg district in the Indian state of Maharashtra.It is a beach destination and remote place in southern Maharashtra. A few years ago, Tarkarli beach was declared a Queen Beach of the Konkan region. Monthly, Thousands of tourists visit this place to rejuvenate and enjoy the thrill of water sports activities.

                              Harihareshwar beach

                              Harihareshwar is a town in Raigad district, in Maharashtra, India. It is surrounded by three hills named Harihareshwar, Harshinachal and Pushpadri.The river Savitri enters the Arabian Sea from the town of Harihareshwar. Towards the north of the town is the temple of Lord Harihareshwar, said to have been blessed by Lord Shiva. Hence Harihareshwar is often referred to as Dev-ghar or "house of God". It is also known as Dakshin Kashi.

                              Alibaug Beach

                              Alibaug Beach, located in Raigad District, Maharashtra, India, is a popular beach destination known for its scenic views, water sports, and historic forts.

                              GanapatiPule beach

                              The Ganpatipule Beach is a spectacular and stunning beach that is located on the Konkan coastline in the Ratnagiri District of Maharashtra in southern India. This pristine beauty is also famous for the 400-year-old Ganesha Temple that can be found here, the idol of which is said to have been self-created and was discovered over 1600 years ago.

                              Diveagar Beach

                              Diveagar (Dive Agar) is a village located in Shrivardhan Taluka, Raigad district in the Indian state of Maharashtra,approximately 170 kilometers south of Mumbai. The region includes a fishing settlement, a beach, a temple, local businesses engaged in coconut and beetle nut tree farming, and some tourism businesses such as restaurants, cottage rentals and hotels, and six villages: Velas, Musalmāndi, Agar Panchaitan, Diveagar, Borli Panchatan, and Karle.

                              Guhagar beach

                              Guhagar beach is of the longest beaches in the Konkan region that boasts of its clean and vast stretch of white sand. Guhagar is a city in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra in India, located at an hour's distance from Chiplun, an ancient city known for its mangoes and coconut. Guhagar beach is picnic spot visited by those who prefer peaceful beaches where they can quietly sit down and relax.

                              Nagaon beach

                              Located on the shores of the Arabian sea, Nagaon beach is 9 km away from Alibaug's city centre. Lined palms, betel, and Suru trees, this beach is most famous for its cleanliness and for hosting water-based adventure activities available at a reasonable price. Experience the life of the locals at the many homestays and resorts here, which make Nagaon Beach the perfect weekend getaway.

                              Devbaug beach

                              Jack's coastal heaven is exactly situated in front of Devbagh beach. This beach is one of the most famous beach from Malvan to visit. Devbagh beach is famous for resorts, watersports activities and, its natural beauty. One can enjoy watching the sun set at Devbagh beach while having a cup of tea or coffee in our resort. Beach is very clean and wide it gives a soothing feeling and people can feel relaxed watching the Arabian sea lushing waves. Beach offers the beautiful serene of Devbagh.

                              Kihim beach

                              Located just 12 kilometres from Alibaug, Kihim Beach is famous for butterflies and birds. The beach is adorned with incredible golden sand. Water sports along with activities like Camel Ride and ATV are available. Beautiful migratory and resident birds also make their way to the Kihim beach and are found in abundance here.

                              Mandwa beach

                              A popular weekend beach destination from Mumbai city, this beach is situated in the village of Mandwa in Maharashtra. It is very accessible because of the direct ferry services which are available near Mandwa beach to and from Mumbai city. A serene and quaint beach, Mandwa is not going to disappoint you.

                              Revdanda Beach

                              Revdanda Beach belongs to Revdanda village, which lies about 17 kms from Alibaug and only 105 kms from Mumbai. It is a remote beach that’s located on the Konkan coast of Maharashtra and is filled with black and clean sand. At this place, you could probably get the quiet spot you look forward to on a beach vacation, while trying to beat the blues and rejuvenate your frayed nerves.

                              Shrivardhan Beach

                              Shrivardhan (also spelled Shriwardhan) is a taluka, city, and local governing body in the Raigad district of the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is renowned as the birthplace of Balaji Vishwanath, the first Peshwa (1713–1720) and father of Bajirao I, who held the position of Deshmukh in the town. It has developed into a seaside resort, along with the nearby town of Harihareshwar, which also has a Shiva temple.

                              Juhu Beach

                              It is the most popular beach in Mumbai. Spread over five Kms long seashore along along coastal line. The beach is frequently visited by tourists. The beach is generally crowded in the evening as the visitors usually come these hours for fresh air and pleasure strolling.

                              Versova Beach

                              Versova is an upmarket neighbourhood in north-western Mumbai. It is known for its beach and the Versova Fort. The beach of Versova undertook a massive clean-up effort in 2016, labelled as the largest ever beach clean-up.

                              Girgaon Chowpatty Beach

                              Girgaon Chowpatty is one of the most famous beaches in Mumbai City, Maharashtra. The beach runs along with Mumbai’s famous Marine Drive for 5 km. The name ‘Girgaon’ is made up of two Sanskrit words Giri meaning hills and Gaon meaning village as it is located between the two hills - Malabar and Cumbala. It is also known for its beautiful art deco buildings. Girgaon Chowpatty is a major attraction for tourists and locals who enjoy street food and fun rides with their friends and families.

                              Aksa Beach

                              Aksa Beach is a popular beach and a vacation spot in Aksa village in Malad, Mumbai, India. It is situated close to Marvé Beach. It is a popular weekend destination and is dotted with many private cottages and hotels, some of which are rented out to tourists and visitors.

                              Gorai Beach

                              The Gorai beach in Mumbai is one of the most frequented beaches by the local people and tourists alike, popular for its location. Locals from Mumbai’s north suburb often come here to enjoy an evening or even an entire day outing. The beach is ideal for a full day picnic with your family. Gorai beach is known as Lovers Point beach as well since this is the place where lovers meet secretly in the beach’s isolation and privacy for the last three to four decades.

                              Kelshi Beach

                              Kelshi beach is situated south of Mandangad. About 33 km from Dapoli, this place is untouched Konkan. The sandy beach is all set for a swim & walk by. A forest all along gives a view of coconut trees and casuarina trees. Very less crowdy though equipped with beachside hotels makes it easier for a traveler. The beach is clean & quiet.

                              Mandavi beach

                              Mandvi Beach at Mandavi Palace is a deluxe camp, comprising, ten hand crafted tents. Each tent has its own verandah, spacious air-conditioned bedroom and state of the art attached bathrooms with running hot and cold water. Each of the tents is interior decorated to resemble the colonial-period camps of erstwhile royalty with carved furniture The camp has 24 hour electricity with back up generators.

                              Murud beach

                              Situated in the town of Dapoli, the Murud beach is known for the scenic views of the surrounding landscape and adventurous water sports. And if you're lucky, you might even have the pleasure of encountering a few friendly dolphins here! Being one of the most popular tourist spots in town, this beach is always thronged with people and is a destination bubbling with activity.

                              Chivla beach

                              Chivla Beach, located less than a kilometre from the Malvan region, is a divine location that offers much more than just beautiful views. It even promises to captivate visitors with the adventure activities organized here. Nature lovers and couples frequent this location because it is clean, pristine, and peaceful.

                              Page no: 3/4

                              Detailed View :

                              Previous Next

                              Tarkarli Beach

                              Overview
                              Tarkarli Beach, located in Sindhudurg District, Maharashtra, India, is a scenic beach destination known for its pristine waters, white sand, and water sports.

                              Location
                              • Tarkarli, Sindhudurg District, Maharashtra
                              • Distance from Mumbai: 550 km (340 miles)
                              • Distance from Goa: 120 km (75 miles)
                              • Beach Length: 5 km (3.1 miles)
                              Tips and Essentials
                              • Best Time to Visit: October to May
                              • Accommodation: Beach resorts, hotels, and homestays
                              • Food: Seafood, local Maharashtrian cuisine
                              • Activities: Book water sports and boat rides in advances
                              Places to visit
                              • Tarkarli Beach: Pristine waters and white sand
                              • Sindhudurg Fort: Historic 17th-century fort
                              • Malvan Marine Sanctuary: Spot dolphins and other marine life
                              • Tsunami Island: Water sports and scenic views
                              • Devbagh Beach: Secluded beach with scenic views
                              Things to Do
                              • Water Sports: Snorkeling, scuba diving, parasailing, and jet-skiing
                              • Beach Walks: Stroll along the beach and enjoy sunset views
                              • Dolphin Watching: Spot dolphins in their natural habitat
                              • Fishing: Try your hand at fishing with local fishermen
                              • Boat Rides: Explore nearby islands and scenic views
                              Water Sports Prices
                              • Snorkeling: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              • Scuba Diving: ₹1,500 - ₹2,500
                              • Parasailing: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              • Jet-Skiing: ₹500 - ₹800

                              Page no: 3/4

                              Detailed View :

                              Previous Next

                              Harihareshwar Beach

                              Overview
                              Harihareshwar Beach, located in Raigad District, Maharashtra, India, is a scenic beach destination known for its pristine waters, white sand, and historic temple.

                              Location
                              Location: Harihareshwar, Raigad District, Maharashtra.
                              Places to Explore
                              • Harihareshwar Beach: Pristine waters and white sand
                              • Harihareshwar Temple: Historic Shiva temple
                              • Kalbhairav Temple: Ancient temple with scenic views
                              • Ganesh Gully: Scenic gorge with Ganesh idol
                              • Bagmandala Creek: Scenic creek with boat rides

                              Things to Do
                              • Beach Walks: Stroll along the beach and enjoy sunset views
                              • Temple Visits: Explore Harihareshwar and Kalbhairav temples
                              • Water Sports: Boating, fishing, and swimming
                              • Trekking: Explore nearby hills and scenic views
                              • Photography: Capture beach and temple moments
                              Tips and Essentials
                              • Best Time to Visit: October to May
                              • Accommodation: Beach resorts, hotels, and homestays
                              • Food: Seafood, local Maharashtrian cuisine
                              • Safety: Follow water sports safety guidelines
                              Places to visit
                              • Shrivardhan Beach (20 km)
                              • Diveagar Beach (30 km)
                              • Murud-Janjira Fort (40 km)
                              • Raigad Fort (60 km)
                              • Mumbai (200 km)
                              How to reach
                              Harihareshwar Beach, located in Raigad District, Maharashtra, India, is a scenic beach destination known for its pristine waters, scenic views, and tranquil atmosphere. Here's how to reach Harihareshwar Beach:
                              • By Air:
                              • Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (BOM), Mumbai (170 km, 3.5 hours)
                              • From Airport: Hire a taxi or take a bus to Harihareshwar (approx. ₹2,500 - ₹4,000)
                              • By Train
                              • Nearest Railway Station: Mangaon Railway Station (MNG), Maharashtra (45 km, 1 hour)
                              • From Station: Hire a taxi or take a bus to Harihareshwar (approx. ₹500 - ₹1,000)
                              • By Bus:Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) buses from Mumbai, Pune, and Kolhapur
                              • Local Transport:Auto-rickshaws and taxis available from Mangaon and Roha

                              Page no: 3/4

                              Alibaug Beach

                              Overview
                              Alibaug Beach, located in Raigad District, Maharashtra, India, is a popular beach destination known for its scenic views, water sports, and historic forts.

                              Location
                              Location:Alibaug, Raigad District, Maharashtra
                              Places to Explore
                              • Alibaug Beach: Scenic views and water sports
                              • Alibaug Fort: 17th-century fort with historic significance
                              • Kolaba Fort: Sea fort with scenic views
                              • Kanakeshwar Forest: Scenic forest with trekking trails
                              • Murud-Janjira Fort: Historic fort with stunning views (30 km)

                              Things to Do
                              • Water Sports: Snorkeling, scuba diving, parasailing, and jet-skiing
                              • Beach Walks: Stroll along the beach and enjoy sunset views
                              • Dolphin Watching: Spot dolphins in their natural habitat
                              • Boat Rides: Explore nearby islands and scenic views
                              • Fishing: Try your hand at fishing with local fishermen
                              Tips and Essentials
                              • Best Time to Visit: October to May
                              • Accommodation: Beach resorts, hotels, and homestays
                              • Food: Seafood, local Maharashtrian cuisine
                              • Safety: Follow water sports safety guidelines
                              Places to visit
                              • Murud-Janjira Fort (30 km)
                              • Shrivardhan Beach (40 km)
                              • Diveagar Beach (50 km)
                              • Raigad Fort (60 km)
                              • Mumbai (100 km)
                              Water Sports Prices
                              • Boating: ₹500 - ₹1,000
                              • Jet-Skiing: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              • Parasailing: ₹1,000 - ₹1,500
                              • Snorkeling: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              How to reach
                              • By Road: Mumbai-Alibaug Road (100 km)
                              • By Ferry: Mumbai-Alibaug Ferry (1 hour)
                              • By Train: Panvel-Alibaug Train (2 hours)
                              • By Air: Mumbai Airport (100 km)

                              GanapatiPule Beach

                              Places to Explore

                              • Jaigad Fort: 17th-century fort with stunning views (20 km)

                              Things to Do

                              Revdanda Beach

                              Overview
                              Revdanda Beach, located in Raigad District, Maharashtra, India, is a scenic beach destination known for its pristine waters, white sand, and historic Revdanda Fort.

                              Location
                              Revdanda, Raigad District, Maharashtra
                              Places to Explore
                              • Revdanda Beach: Pristine waters and white sand
                              • Revdanda Fort: Historic fort with stunning views
                              • Korlai Fort: Historic fort with scenic views (10 km)
                              • Alibaug Beach: Scenic beach with water sports (15 km)
                              • Murud-Janjira Fort: Historic fort with stunning views (25 km)

                              Things to Do
                              • Beach Walks: Stroll along the beach and enjoy sunset views
                              • Temple Visits: Explore Ganapati and Swayambhu Ganapati temples
                              • Water Sports: Boating, jet-skiing, parasailing, and snorkeling
                              • Trekking: Explore nearby hills and scenic views
                              • Photography: Capture beach and temple moments
                              Tips and Essentials
                              • Best Time to Visit: October to May
                              • Accommodation: Beach resorts, hotels, and homestays
                              • Food: Seafood, local Maharashtrian cuisine
                              • Safety: Follow water sports safety guidelines
                              Places to visit
                              • Alibaug Beach (10 km)
                              • Murud-Janjira Fort (20 km)
                              • Kolaba Fort (25 km)
                              • Shrivardhan Beach (30 km)
                              • Mumbai (120 km)
                              Water Sports Prices
                              • Boating: ₹500 - ₹1,000
                              • Jet-Skiing: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              • Parasailing: ₹1,000 - ₹1,500
                              • Snorkeling: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              How to reach
                              • By Road: Mumbai-Revdanda Road (125 km)
                              • By Ferry: Mumbai-Revdanda Ferry (1.5 hours)
                              • By Train: Panvel-Revdanda Train (70 km)
                              • By Air: Mumbai Airport (125 km)

                              Murud beach

                              Overview
                              Murud Beach is a stunning destination located in Dapoli, known for its breathtaking views of the sun, sky, sand, and sea. You can indulge in thrilling water sports like parasailing and banana boat rides, or take a leisurely horse ride along the shore. The beach is also famous for its delectable seafood dishes and sweet corn, making it a foodie's paradise.

                              Location
                              Murud Beach is located in Dapoli, Ratnagiri District, Maharashtra, India.
                              Places to Explore
                              • Murud Janjira Fort: Historic fort with stunning views
                              • Kashid Beach: Picturesque beach with pristine white sand
                              • Unhavare Hot Springs: Natural hot spring for relaxation
                              • Dapoli: Explore the town's markets and seafood restaurants
                              Things to Do
                              • Water Sports: Parasailing, banana boat rides, jet skiing
                              • Horse Riding
                              • Swimming
                              • Dolphin Watching
                              • Beach Volleyball and other games
                              Tips and Essentials
                              • Best Time to Visit: October to May
                              • Accommodation: Beach resorts, hotels, and homestays
                              • Food: Seafood, local Maharashtrian cuisine
                              • Safety: Follow water sports safety guidelines
                              Nearby Attractions
                              • Murud Janjira Fort (5 km)
                              • Janjira Jal-Durg (5 km)
                              • Murud's Dattatray Temple (5 km)
                              • Dasghar Temple (20 km)
                              • Sri Ganesh Temple (25 km)
                              Water Sports Prices
                              • Boating: ₹500 - ₹1,000
                              • Jet-Skiing: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              • Parasailing: ₹1,000 - ₹1,500
                              • Snorkeling: ₹800 - ₹1,200
                              How to reach
                              • By Air: The nearest airport is Mumbai Airport (180 km), followed by a bus/car ride.
                              • By Train: The nearest railway station is Khed (100 km), connected to major cities.
                              • By Road: Regular buses from Mumbai, Pune, and Ratnagiri.

                              Chivla Beach is a serene and picturesque destination located in Malvan, Maharashtra, India. Here's essential information for tourists:
